DOC.brief_title: A Study Different Use Regimens Using Two Acne Treatments
DOC.detailed_description: Approximately 240 subject enrol randomized , multi-center study . Following satisfaction entry criterion screen procedure , subject receive RETIN-A MICRO PUMP 0.04 % 5 % Benzoyl Peroxide wash ( OTC ) entire 12-week treatment period . Subjects randomize either morning treatment ( test ) morning/evening treatment ( active control ) . Subjects assess baseline , week 3 , week 6 end therapy , week 12 number type individual lesion safety . At select site , photograph take time point . At Week 12 subject assess Investigator 's Global Assessment Acne Severity . The investigator conduct lesion count , global assessment safety assessment .
DOC.criteria: Males nonpregnant nonnursing female , 12 year old , facial acne vulgaris ; Minimum 20 50 inflammatory lesion ( papule pustule ) ; Minimum 30 100 facial noninflammatory lesion ( open close comedo ) ; Must least rating grade 3 Investigator Global severity scale baseline Known sensitivity ingredient study medication ; Any nodulocystic acne lesion ; Use acne device systemic therapy antibiotic within two month prior start throughout duration study ; Use systemic therapy retinoids within four month prior study start throughout duration study ; Topical use retinoids within two week prior study start throughout duration study ; Topical use antibiotic , steroid and/or nonretinoid topical acne product within two week prior study start throughout duration study ; If subject take birth control pill , must stabilize least three month prior study start ; History evidence skin condition disease may require concurrent therapy may interfere evaluation study medication ; Any significant medical condition could confound interpretation study ; Excessive facial hair may interfere evaluation ; No use tan booth , sun lamp , etc .
